Redesign a Flight Booking Mobile App

Role

User researching

Wireframing

UI designing

Timeline

Approx. 1 Week

Platform

Mobile

Tools

Figma, Notion

Overview

Vietjet Air (VJ) is one of the most popular airline brand in Vietnam which has known as a low cost carrier airline flying to domestic & international routes with thousands of flight booking per day.

However, they have been receiving so many bad feedbacks from users. One of the reasons is their poorly-designed interface.

Problem

I defined some several crucial problems about UI principals and philosophy UX

  • ðŸ˜ª Too many colors
  • ðŸ˜ª Typography is not easy to read
  • ðŸ˜ª Tight spacing
  • ðŸ˜ª Too many required inputs

I would like to go into details as below

Text Color

Using text dark color and red color in unnecessary places makes everything highlighted. This is the reason why hierarchy is not good. It's really hard for user focus on the priority information.

My solution is using 7 different shade of grey. I use a light grey for icons and lines because they are indicator factors and not necessary to be bold.

Brand Color

In their app, they use red and yellow for their brand color and green for highlighting. It makes users be confused.

Here, I reduced into 2 colors. Red is primary color. And using yellow as the second one to highlight.

Typography

As I understand, they try to use their brand typo because they want users remember it. If it is used for promotion banner, it is totally fine.

However, using the typo to highlight crucial information is not a great choice. This typo is quite stylish and it is not easy to read if it is repeated so many times.

Spacing

The current app has 3 main problem:
1) too many choices
2) too much thought required
3) lack of clarity.

Based on Miller's Law, to understand how to reduce cognitive load, my solution is applying 8px spacing to keep user's eyes not tired and makes the design be cleaner and spacing more consistent

Booking Process

color, typo
